@graph.name: Healthy Pumpkin Bread - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Healthy pumpkin bread is tender and moist with a beautiful crumb. It's naturally sweetened, perfectly spiced and made with whole wheat flour.

@graph.name: What goes well with healthy pumpkin bread?

acceptedAnswer.text: I like to serve this bread with a slather of homemade cinnamon butter, and on the side of a savory dish like this egg casserole. Always with a warm cup of coffee!

@graph.name: Can I leave the bread out overnight?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can leave it out in an airtight container (or in the loaf pan) overnight.

@graph.name: Can I replace the eggs in this recipe?

acceptedAnswer.text: I haven't tried replacing the eggs, but if you'd like to try use an egg replacer, chia egg or flax egg.

@graph.name: Healthy Pumpkin Bread Recipe
@graph.description: This healthy pumpkin bread is tender and moist with a beautiful crumb, naturally sweetened, perfectly spiced and made with whole wheat flour but you'd never guess it’s good for you!

video.name: Healthy Pumpkin Bread Recipe
video.description: This healthy pumpkin bread is tender and moist with a beautiful crumb. It's naturally sweetened, perfectly spiced and made with whole wheat flour but you'd never guess it’s good for you!

recipeIngredient: 15 oz pumpkin puree (1 can, 1 ½ cups)
¾ cup pure maple syrup (or honey)
1 ½ cups whole wheat pastry flour
4 TBS raw sugar ((for sprinkling on top - optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9x5” loaf pan. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9x5” loaf pan. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine whole wheat pastry flour, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and sea salt. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine whole wheat pastry flour, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and sea salt. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, melted butter, Greek yogurt, maple syrup, eggs and vanilla until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, melted butter, Greek yogurt, maple syrup, eggs and vanilla until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry ingredients and stir until mixture is smooth and there are no lumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry ingredients and stir until mixture is smooth and there are no lumps.

recipeInstructions.text: If desired, add mix-ins (chocolate chips, nuts, seeds, etc.).
recipeInstructions.name: If desired, add mix-ins (chocolate chips, nuts, seeds, etc.).

recipeInstructions.text: Evenly spread batter into prepared loaf pan. If desired, sprinkle the top with raw sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Evenly spread batter into prepared loaf pan. If desired, sprinkle the top with raw sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake on the lower rack in the preheated oven for 55-65 minutes, or until the top is set and a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake on the lower rack in the preheated oven for 55-65 minutes, or until the top is set and a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool in the pan for 1 hour. Then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool in the pan for 1 hour. Then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

@graph.keywords: healthy pumpkin bread, healthy pumpkin bread recipe, whole wheat pumpkin bread
